refentry.refsect1: Stability Level Unstable, unless otherwise indicated

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The language engines are rendering-system independent engines that determine line, word, and character breaks for character strings. These engines are used in pango_break().

refsect2.title: PangoEngineLang
refsect2.para: The PangoEngineLang class is implemented by engines that customize the rendering-system independent part of the Pango pipeline for a particular script or language. For instance, a custom PangoEngineLang could be provided for Thai to implement the dictionary-based word boundary lookups needed for that language.

refsect2.title: PangoEngineLangClass

listitem.simpara: Provides a custom implementation of pango_break(). If NULL, pango_default_break() is used instead. If not NULL, for Pango versions before 1.16 (module interface version before 1.6.0), this was called instead of pango_default_break(), but in newer versions, pango_default_break() is always called and this is called after that to allow tailoring the breaking results.

refsect2.title: PANGO_ENGINE_TYPE_LANG
refsect2.para: A string constant defining the engine type for language engines. These engines derive from PangoEngineLang.

refsect2.title: PANGO_ENGINE_LANG_DEFINE_TYPE()
refsect2.para: Outputs the necessary code for GObject type registration for a PangoEngineLang class defined in a module. Two static symbols are defined.

para.programlisting: static GType prefix_type; static void prefix_register_type (GTypeModule module);

refsect2.para: The prefix_register_type() function should be called in your script_engine_init() function for each type that your module implements, and then your script_engine_create() function can create instances of the object as follows:

listitem.simpara: Name of the the type to register (for example:, ArabicEngineFc
Prefix for symbols that will be defined (for example:, arabic_engine_fc
Class initialization function for the new type, or NULL
Instance initialization function for the new type, or NULL
